results.title: Beginning of life
results.brief_description: Scientists study nature and experiment to discover the basis of evolution. By tracing the history of the element carbon, the evolution of organic matter from cosmic matter to unicellular and multi-cellular organisms is known. Experiments synthesizing complex organic matter from simple substances prove the importance of carbon in the evolution of life; amino acids can be synthesized which are linked with proteins and important to life. No credits available.

results.title: Beginning of history
results.creator_credit: Graham Wallace and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: By using the remains of things made and built by prehistoric man to reconstruct a prehistoric dwelling, this film ambitiously attempts to tell the story of what happened in the ages before the period at which most history books begin. The co-operation of many world famous British museums, societies, and foundations has helped to make this reconstruction, (especially the Iron Age farm), authentic. No credits available.

results.title: Beginning french: intonation
results.brief_description: Compares the characteristic patterns of French and English intonation in a number of every-day phrases and sentences. Analysing French intonation, a class of students learn to listen for basic patterns and their variations, and how to reproduce the characteristic “music” of French speech. Stresses the importance of practice in listening as well as in speaking. No other credits available.

results.title: The Beginning : do you dare to differ?
results.brief_description: Designed to stimulate discussion on the role of the creative individual in relation to his society. The non-narrated film describes how one wiggle-man is inspired to do something different from the rest of his companions. Although they ridicule him, the new idea is proven successful, giving the skeptics the courage to try it too.

results.title: Beginners please
results.creator_credit: Colin Ballantyne and South Australian Housing Trust
results.brief_description: A brief survey of Elizabeth, South Australia focusing on the history of the building of the twin theatres, the Octagon (an eight-sided structure) and the Shedley (smaller and more intimate).

results.title: Before it's too late
results.brief_description: A road safety film emphasizing the importance of using seat belts in vehicles and how they do save lives. Collision tests conducted at the University of California show what can happen in an accident. The uncontrolled movements can damage the body in numerous ways, ejection being the most fatal. Thousands of lives could have been saved if people used their seat belts rather than sat on them. Features Dick Van Dyke.

results.title: A Beethoven sonata
results.brief_description: One of Beethoven’s earliest works is finely played and recorded in this film. Dennis Brain (horn) and Dennis Matthews (piano) give a performance of the Sonata in F for horn and piano, Opus 17. Contrasts the horn as it was in Beethoven’s time with the improved and more complicated instrument of to-day. No other credits available.

results.title: Beethoven piano trio
results.brief_description: A performance of the slow movement of the piano trio (nicknamed “The Ghost”) with an analysis of the themes and structure of the movement. No credits available.
